body:

> The diff coverage is `85.71%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&height=150&src=pr&token=eZ4WkYLtcO)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228?src=pr&el=tree)

##           master   #22228      +/-   ##
==========================================

==========================================
  Files         169      169

==========================================

- Misses       4010     4011       +1

|---|---|---|

|---|---|---|
| [pandas/plotting/\_core.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3Bsb3R0aW5nL19jb3JlLnB5) | `83.48% <ø> (ø)` | :arrow_up: |
| [pandas/core/groupby/groupby.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2NvcmUvZ3JvdXBieS9ncm91cGJ5LnB5) | `96.04% <85.71%> (-0.12%)` | :arrow_down: |

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [ab274c2...adccd1a](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/22228?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
There is a python2 versus python3 discrepancy that's causing some CI tests to fail. I opened #22285 to deal with it.
One job failed for no reason. Otherwise it's green.

Making a new function that does this is pretty straightforward:
```diff
diff --git a/pandas/core/groupby/groupby.py b/pandas/core/groupby/groupby.py
index 3f84fa0..2d324f4 100644
--- a/pandas/core/groupby/groupby.py
+++ b/pandas/core/groupby/groupby.py
@@ -1001,6 +1001,13 @@ class GroupBy(_GroupBy):
     len(grouped) : int
         Number of groups
     """
+    def new_hist(self, bins=10, equal_bins=False, **kwargs):
+        if equal_bins and is_scalar(bins):
+            # share the same numpy array for all group bins
+            bins = np.linspace(self.obj.min(),
+                               self.obj.max(), bins + 1)
+        return self.hist(bins=bins, **kwargs)
+
     def _bool_agg(self, val_test, skipna):
         """Shared func to call any / all Cython GroupBy implementations"""
```

but I don't know how to overload `SeriesGroupBy.hist` without touching the wrappers, or some other sensitive part of the code. I defer this PR to anyone who knows how to do this.
Closing as stale. Ping if you'd like to pick this back up
